BasicSortingEvaluator

enspire.interactivity.evaluation.BasicEvaluator
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.IEvaluator
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.BasicSortingEvaluator
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.BasicDDEvaluator

The most basic class to evaluate sorting-based activities.  Since most sorting interactivities will likely be drag-and-drop, you will probably be using the inherited class BasicDDEvaluator.

This class returns an evaluation of type SimpleEvaluation in its evaluate() method.

Summary
BasicSortingEvaluatorThe most basic class to evaluate sorting-based activities.

BasicSortingEvaluator

public function BasicSortingEvaluator()

addBin

public function addBin(b: IBin)

This type of evaluator requires a bit of setup to ready it for use.  Specifically, we need to keep track of all bins that are participating in the activity.

To see how this operates, see this code from the setupEvaluator() function in the SimpleDDController class.  Note that a Bay extends from a IBin

Example usage

var i = 0;
while(activityArgs["bay"+i] != undefined) {
    evaluator.addBin(activityDisplay.getClip()["bay"+i]);
    evaluator.setBinTargets(activityArgs["bay"+i],activityArgs["bay"+i+"draggers"].split(","));
    i++;
}

setBinTargets

public function setBinTargets(binId: String,
elementIDs: Array)

This type of evaluator requires a bit of setup to ready it for use.  Specifically, we need to know what sorting elements belong in each bin.

To see how this operates, see this code from the setupEvaluator() function in the SimpleDDController class.  Note that a Bay extends from a IBin

Example usage

var i = 0;
while(activityArgs["bay"+i] != undefined) {
    evaluator.addBin(activityDisplay.getClip()["bay"+i]);
    evaluator.setBinTargets(activityArgs["bay"+i],activityArgs["bay"+i+"draggers"].split(","));
    i++;
}

evaluate

public function evaluate():IEvaluation
Really an abstract class.
Event that is dispatched from any Movie Clip that inherits from HotSpot when the standard mouse actions are performed on the clip.
